Literally, i have spend this game, not buying it and it's a bit frustrating to play a non-steam game
But finally i have bought it, i owned it and playing it safely now.
The game has
+ Good graphics
+ Good storyline
+ Challenging AI on Hard mode
+ Nice physics interactions
But the downsides are:
+ Lightning bug still not fixed for years
+ Extremely buggy and instant death if you broke the game physics
+ Sometimes game just drops FPS if i type some texture and graphics commands if i tried to fix the bug
Overall: 9/10

um dos melhores jogos que j√° joguei
Though dated, tedious, and meh in some ways, HL2 is a legendary achievement in video game story telling and technical advancement.

Half Life 2. What is there to say about such an influential game, again? The physics engine alone still holds up to this day while the story still has people captivated to this day.

The story of Gordon Freeman is continued in a very fun and great way, being woke up by G-Man at the start really puts you back into action. The decision to continue the story 20 years later after the Balck Mesa incident and completing ignoring the fact that most people decided to be bloodthirsty megalomaniacs who murdered both friendly and hostile entities was amazing, the fact that they pick obscure characters to be the main characters of this game is also amazing - I bet nobody remembered Eli or Lamarr even after being told who they were back in Half Life by themselves until they decided to replay Half Life again or by playing through the fanmade remake Black Mesa.

This time the character interaction is more than plentiful for us, just like I mentioned in my Half Life review, there hasn‚Äôt been a game like this before or after Half Life 2 - even to this day, I can‚Äôt remember any game that has such a lively cast of characters that has so much but yet so little to say about their situation.

Yet again the choice of giving the character full control of the situation for 99% of the game is worth it. Sure, there are cut scenes at the start and end of the game but other than that everything you decide to see or do is completely based on you - there are moments in which you must see something but they don‚Äôt pin you down but rather change the environment to make that notable moment viable to most players who decide to look in that direction.

The Half Life 2 level design also still holds up to this day, I mean Ravenholm itself could be a standalone game. The fact that I can both ignore things but still know what to do truly showcases how great the level design is, the fact that I can walk away from a character moment where they talk or the environment changing and still know how to traverse the environment thanks to context clues is great.

I truly love how Half Life 2, although being released after the overwhelming release of Half Life and its effect on modern gaming, they still didn‚Äôt go the route of other games of its time - by that I mean, Half Life and Half Life 2 doesn‚Äôt baby you around and lets you BE Gordon Freeman.
One of the most impactful game series for me
